content: any crafters today we're going to make a wooden debris piles and we've made other
you know you've made stone and that kind of thing to read piles but I don't think
too many people think about wooden debris towels but they can be super
useful especially if you're doing scenarios a lot of wood and we've been
featuring our a little hobble that we've been doing and so this is going to tie
into that but yeah these are super easy just as easy to make and they look great
and they can really give a nice effect when things are destroyed and broken so
let's go to the table I'll show you how to easily make some wooden debris piles
Oh
this project really couldn't be easier I just broke up some old wood pieces I
have these are just leftover like popsicle sticks and things and then I
just cut up some cardstock similar size and shape for the bases I just used thin
cardboard now I have added some texture to the base with a hot glue gun and
that's because some of the textural show through the pile of debris so that'll
help give it some more detail then next I just took the bases and applied some
white glue and then just layered the debris pieces on there let it dry and
I'm good to go here's my pile it's been sprayed black and washed with a burnt
umber to give it a nice dark brown so now I'm going to use a nutmeg brown with
a wide brush and I'm going to dry brush this so I'll just load the brush and
then just pull over the surface to really pull out those pieces
there you go a nice pile of debris now my nutmeg brown is dried and that looks
really nice you can see but I want to add a little more detail to it so I'm
gonna use a camel Brown and this thin flat brush and I'm gonna grab some load
the brush with some camel and then I'm going to kind of follow the edge of
these pieces and that'll kind of bring that out a bit and just give it a little
bit more dimension alright that's looking nice so there we
go we got a nice highlight on there it really adds pulls out some of those
details give some dimensionality do that here we go you can see I have a tray
with a bunch of them that I've made so if you have an encounter where your feet
you might need this stuff you can just store it and then have it all ready so
if the like I showed in the preview if the hobgoblins smashed the door down
you've got to a small one there you can use just pop it there for the door if
the you know the table gets smashed you could put you know that down for the
table if the building is getting smashed you could put you put one there and one
there like that so it's kind of symbolize that the walls getting broken
down so really nice and what I like about these is the characters easily
stand on these if you get too creative but it gives you the effect if you get
too crazy with this and make them all you know piled up then the characters
are going to be falling over and all that kind of stuff so especially some
top heavy figures so I always think about playability when I make these
things so there we go there's some wooden debris piles and I'll see you
next time on the craft hey you yeah you back here huh I know it was short what
do you expect there's a short tip watch longer episodes if you want jeez
quit bugging me hey and make sure you join the forum - how much for that oh
yeah and have a magical craft astok day you
